Articles.Content: Made good use of the nose cone today. Any more parts brewing?

I had noticed some texturing flaws in the pure stock mk 3 parts, and I have been meaning to learn to texture, model, and code to create some mods and the mk 3 was one of the stock part groups I was planning on giving an overhaul. But since you are doing this I figured I'd ask if you needed some help. I had created some concept art for the overhaul, including some mk 3 and mk 2 fuselage part ideas I came up with, if you are interested pm me.

Made good use of the nose cone today. Any more parts brewing?

Work on this pack has been pushed back because I'm assisting helldiver with the Kerbin Shuttle Orbiter. I will do some more parts for this after it's out.
All this needs now is a re-texture of the original squad cockpit (bleugh yuck) and a cargo bay !

All this needs now is a re-texture of the original squad cockpit (bleugh yuck) and a cargo bay !

There already is a mod for a mk3 cargobay

one thing I think you should do is re-texture the mk 3 to mk 2 adapter as it uses the same texture as the mk 2 to standard fuselage adapter. the only difference is the mesh and the anterior mk3 plate.

There already is a mod for a mk3 cargobay

Doesn't seem to work :/

Doesn't seem to work :/

If you're referring to TT's Mk3 cargo bays, they're working great as long as you edit the .cfg so that its contents get wrapped in a PART { ...}

Building a Mk3-bed shuttle today, I noticed that the Mk3-2.5m adapter got a small "green" node on the 2.5m side instead of the usual large one. Just a thing you might want to adjust once you get back to this project.

If you're referring to TT's Mk3 cargo bays, they're working great as long as you edit the .cfg so that its contents get wrapped in a PART { ...}

Or just install them into the legacy KSP/Parts folder instead of into Gamedata. They don't need to be edited if you put them in the legacy folder.
I've now built a series of shuttles and other craft using these parts. Many thanks for making them!

I've now built a series of shuttles and other craft using these parts. Many thanks for making them!

Glad people have used these, I'll be making some other stuff for this set soon.

Glad people have used these, I'll be making some other stuff for this set soon.

Uhh. Can't wait for it.
Dibs on stackable cargo bay + tricouplers/radial oms attachment port
My offer and suggestion still stands if you want. Just clarifying as no one seems to have taken notice of my posts.
Yes if you want to share any more ideas for parts that are needed feel free to and I might make them when I have the time to. I'll be getting back to these sometime soon.
+1 for new textures and a longer cargobay(than the tt one). Plus maybe more adapters

Yes if you want to share any more ideas for parts that are needed feel free to and I might make them when I have the time to. I'll be getting back to these sometime soon.

K, I'll get to work on some concept art, still learning to texture and model so, I won't be of any use to you in texturing for a while.

(update) Concept art is coming along nicely. started to retexture stock mk 3 parts, a still lost but staring to figure it out.

Edited February 10, 2014 by Noctrian
(updated)

you could make an inverted adapter so that you can make things that actually look like planes. also mk3 fuselages with LFO so that you can make shuttles that are somewhat useful. please critique my comment guys, my best ideas occur in response to critique.
Already started work again on this one or are you still fully busy with KSO?

Already started work again on this one or are you still fully busy with KSO?

Sry, missed this post. Here is a small preview pic of the WIP.

The exterior of the command pod is being cleaned up and redone with new materials to make a safer and more stylish looking craft.
Nice, it's bigger, cleaner, and opens wider, YAY!!!
Wow that cockpit is so clean, I love it and the cargo wow. great job nazari
That looks great!

Looking great. I am very happy to see this size getting a work over.

thank.s
